public ref class Parallel abstract sealed

summary.span: 提供对并行循环和区域的支持。

span.span: Provides support for parallel loops and regions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类为常见操作（如 for 循环、每个循环和执行一组语句）提供了基于库的数据并行替换。The class provides library-based data parallel replacements for common operations such as for loops, for each loops, and execution of a set of statements. ## Examples 此示例演示了使用多个语言构造实现并行循环的几种方法。This example demonstrates several approaches to implementing a parallel loop using multiple language constructs. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Parallel#07](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallel/cs/parallelintro.cs#07)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Parallel#07](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallel/vb/parallelintro.vb#07)]

threadsafe.span: 的所有公共和受保护的成员 都是线程安全的，可从多个线程并发使用。

span.span: All public and protected members of are thread-safe and may be used concurrently from multiple threads.
Data Parallelism (Task Parallel Library)

related.span: 用于与 .NET Core 和 .NET Standard 并行编程的示例

span.span: Samples for Parallel Programming with the .NET Core and .NET Standard

summary.span: 执行 循环，其中可能会并行运行迭代。

span.span: Executes a loop in which iterations may run in parallel.

summary.span: 执行 循环，其中可能会并行运行迭代，而且可以监视和操作循环的状态。

span.span: Executes a loop in which iterations may run in parallel and the state of the loop can be monitored and manipulated.

returns.span: 包含有关已完成的循环部分的信息的结构。

span.span: A structure that contains information about which portion of the loop completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`对于迭代范围 (的每个值调用一次委托 `fromInclusive` ， `toExclusive`) 。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each value in the iteration range (`fromInclusive`, `toExclusive`). 提供两个参数：It is provided with two arguments: - 一个 值，该值表示迭代次数。An value that represents the iteration count. - 可用于提前中断循环的实例。A instance that can be used to break out of the loop prematurely. 对象是由编译器创建的; 它不能在用户代码中实例化。The object is created by the compiler; it cannot be instantiated in user code. 调用 方法会通知 `for` 操作，在当前的迭代之后，无需执行迭代。Calling the method informs the `for` operation that iterations after the current one don't have to execute. 不过，如果所有迭代尚未执行，则仍必须执行当前的所有迭代。However, all iterations before the current one will still have to be executed if they haven't already. 因此，调用 类似于 `for` c # 等语言中的传统循环内的中断操作，但它并不是完美的替代方法：例如，无法保证当前的迭代不会执行。Therefore, calling is similar to using a break operation within a conventional `for` loop in a language like C#, but it is not a perfect substitute: For example, there is no guarantee that iterations after the current one will definitely not execute. 如果在不需要当前迭代之前执行所有迭代，请使用方法，而不是 使用 。If executing all iterations before the current one is not necessary, use the method instead of using . 调用 会通知 `for` 循环，它可能会放弃所有剩余迭代，而不管它们是在当前迭代之前还是之后，因为所有必需的工作都已完成。Calling informs the `for` loop that it may abandon all remaining iterations, regardless of whether they're before or after the current iteration, because all required work will have already been completed. 但是，与一样 ，不能保证不会执行其他迭代。However, as with , there are no guarantees regarding which other iterations will not execute. 如果某个循环过早结束，则 返回的结构将包含有关该循环完成的相关信息。If a loop is ended prematurely, the structure that is returned will contain relevant information about the loop's completion. 如果 `fromInclusive` 大于或等于 `toExclusive` ，则该方法立即返回，而不执行任何迭代。If `fromInclusive` is greater than or equal to `toExclusive`, the method returns immediately without performing any iterations. ## Examples 下面的示例并行执行最多100迭代的循环。The following example executes up to 100 iterations of a loop in parallel. 每个迭代都将暂停1到1000毫秒的随机间隔。Each iteration pauses for a random interval from 1 to 1,000 milliseconds. 随机生成的值确定调用方法的循环迭代 。A randomly generated value determines on which iteration of the loop the method is called. 如示例的输出所示，在调用方法后，索引大于属性值的任何迭代都不会 开始 。As the output from the example shows, no iterations whose index is greater than the property value start after the call to the method. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.ParallelLoopState#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallelloopstate/cs/break1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.ParallelLoopState#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallelloopstate/vb/break1.vb#2)] 由于调用方法时循环的迭代仍可能会执行，因此 每次迭代都会调用 属性来检查其他迭代是否已调用 方法。Because iterations of the loop are still likely to be executing when the method is called, each iteration calls the property to check whether another iteration has called the method. 如果属性值为 `true` ，则迭代会检查属性的值， 如果该值大于当前迭代的索引值，则会立即返回。If the property value is `true`, the iteration checks the value of the property and, if it is greater than the current iteration's index value, returns immediately.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`对于迭代范围 (的每个值调用一次委托 `fromInclusive` ， `toExclusive`) 。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each value in the iteration range (`fromInclusive`, `toExclusive`). 提供了以下参数：迭代计数 () ，以及 可能用于提前跳出循环的实例。It is provided with the following parameters: the iteration count (), and a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely. 调用 方法会通知 `for` 操作：在当前的迭代之后无需执行迭代，而在当前迭代之前的所有迭代都将执行。Calling the method informs the `for` operation that iterations after the current one don't have to be executed, but all iterations before the current one do. 因此，调用 Break 类似于 `for` c # 等语言中的传统循环内的中断操作，但它并不是完美的替代方法：例如，无法保证当前的迭代不会执行。Therefore, calling Break is similar to using a break operation within a conventional `for` loop in a language like C#, but it is not a perfect substitute: For example, there is no guarantee that iterations after the current one will definitely not execute. 如果在不需要当前迭代之前执行所有迭代，请使用方法，而不是 使用 。If executing all iterations before the current one is not necessary, use the method instead of using . 调用 会通知 `for` 循环，它可能会放弃所有剩余迭代，而不管它们是在当前迭代之前还是之后，因为所有必需的工作都已完成。Calling informs the `for` loop that it may abandon all remaining iterations, regardless of whether they're before or after the current iteration, because all required work will have already been completed. 但是，与一样 ，不能保证不会执行其他迭代。However, as with , there are no guarantees regarding which other iterations will not execute. 如果某个循环过早结束，则 返回的结构将包含有关该循环完成的相关信息。If a loop is ended prematurely, the structure that is returned will contain relevant information about the loop's completion. 如果 `fromInclusive` 大于或等于 `toExclusive` ，则方法立即返回，而不执行任何迭代。If `fromInclusive` is greater than or equal to `toExclusive`, then the method returns immediately without performing any iterations.

span.span: Executes a loop with thread-local data in which iterations may run in parallel, and the state of the loop can be monitored and manipulated.

returns.span: 包含有关已完成的循环部分的信息的结构。

span.span: A structure that contains information about which portion of the loop completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`对于迭代范围 (的每个值调用一次委托 `fromInclusive` ， `toExclusive`) 。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each value in the iteration range (`fromInclusive`, `toExclusive`). 提供了以下参数：迭代计数 () 、 可能用于提前跳出循环的实例，以及可能在同一线程上执行的迭代之间共享的某种本地状态。It is provided with the following parameters: the iteration count (), a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`对于参与循环执行的每个任务，将调用该委托一次，并返回这些任务的初始本地状态。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 这些初始状态将传递给每个任务的第一次 `body` 调用。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然后，每个后续的主体调用都将返回一个可能修改的状态值，并将其传递给下一个主体调用。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最后，每个任务的最后一个主体调用返回传递给委托的状态值 `localFinally` 。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. 每 `localFinally` 个任务调用一次委托，以便对每个任务的本地状态执行最后一个操作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task's local state. 可对多个任务同时调用此委托;因此，必须同步对任何共享变量的访问。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 此 方法在其执行生存期内使用的任务比线程多，因为现有任务完成并被新任务取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 这使基础 对象有机会添加、更改或删除为循环提供服务的线程。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop. 如果 `fromInclusive` 大于或等于 `toExclusive` ，则方法立即返回，而不执行任何迭代。If `fromInclusive` is greater than or equal to `toExclusive`, then the method returns immediately without performing any iterations. 有关使用此方法的示例，请参阅 how [to： Write a Parallel For Loop with Thread-Local Variables](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-parallel-for-loop-with-thread-local-variables)。For an example that uses this method, see [How to: Write a Parallel.For Loop with Thread-Local Variables](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-parallel-for-loop-with-thread-local-variables).

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`对于迭代范围 (的每个值调用一次委托 `fromInclusive` ， `toExclusive`) 。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each value in the iteration range (`fromInclusive`, `toExclusive`). 提供了以下参数：迭代计数 () 、 可能用于提前跳出循环的实例，以及可能在同一线程上执行的迭代之间共享的某种本地状态。It is provided with the following parameters: the iteration count (), a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. 将 `localInit` 为参与循环执行的每个线程调用一次委托，并返回每个线程的初始本地状态。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each thread that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those threads. 这些初始状态将传递到 `body` 每个线程上的第一次调用。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each thread. 然后，每个后续的主体调用都将返回一个可能修改的状态值，并将其传递给下一个主体调用。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最后，每个线程上的最后一个主体调用返回传递给委托的状态值 `localFinally` 。Finally, the last body invocation on each thread returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. 每 `localFinally` 个线程调用一次委托，以便对每个线程的本地状态执行最后一个操作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per thread to perform a final action on each thread's local state. 可以在多个线程上同时调用此委托;因此，必须同步对任何共享变量的访问。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple threads; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 此 方法在其执行生存期内使用的任务比线程多，因为现有任务完成并被新任务取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 这使基础 对象有机会添加、更改或删除为循环提供服务的线程。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop. 如果 `fromInclusive` 大于或等于 `toExclusive` ，则方法立即返回，而不执行任何迭代。If `fromInclusive` is greater than or equal to `toExclusive`, then the method returns immediately without performing any iterations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果要重写默认分区方案，则会提供此重载。This overload is provided for scenarios where you want to override the default partitioning scheme. 例如，小型循环主体可能会受益于对范围进行分区。For example, small loop bodies might benefit from partitioning the range. 方法要求自定义分区程序以支持动态分区。The method expects custom partitioners to support dynamic partitioning. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [用于 PLINQ 和 TPL 的自定义分区程序](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl) 和 [如何：实现动态分区](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions)。For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl) and [How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions). `localInit`对于参与循环执行的每个任务，将调用该委托一次，并返回这些任务的初始本地状态。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 这些初始状态将传递给每个任务的第一次 `body` 调用。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然后，每个后续的主体调用都将返回一个可能修改的状态值，并将其传递给下一个主体调用。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最后，每个任务的最后一个主体调用返回传递给委托的状态值 `localFinally` 。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. 每 `localFinally` 个任务调用一次委托，以便对每个任务的本地状态执行最后一个操作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task's local state. 可对多个任务同时调用此委托;因此，必须同步对任何共享变量的访问。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 此 方法在其执行生存期内使用的任务比线程多，因为现有任务完成并被新任务取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 这使基础 对象有机会添加、更改或删除为循环提供服务的线程。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`为可枚举中的每个元素调用一次委托 `source` 。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each element in the `source` enumerable. 提供了以下参数：当前元素、 可能用于提前跳出循环的实例、当前元素的索引 () ，以及可能在同一线程上执行的迭代之间共享的某些本地状态。It is provided with the following parameters: the current element, a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, the current element's index (), and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`对于参与循环执行的每个任务，将调用该委托一次，并返回这些任务的初始本地状态。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 这些初始状态将传递给每个任务的第一次 `body` 调用。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然后，每个后续的主体调用都将返回一个可能修改的状态值，并将其传递给下一个主体调用。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最后，每个任务的最后一个主体调用返回传递给委托的状态值 `localFinally` 。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. 每 `localFinally` 个任务调用一次委托，以便对每个任务的本地状态执行最后一个操作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task's local state. 可对多个任务同时调用此委托;因此，必须同步对任何共享变量的访问。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 此 方法在其执行生存期内使用的任务比线程多，因为现有任务完成并被新任务取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 这使基础 对象有机会添加、更改或删除为循环提供服务的线程。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果要重写默认分区方案，则会提供此重载。This overload is provided for scenarios where you want to override the default partitioning scheme. 例如，小型循环主体可能会受益于对范围进行分区。For example, small loop bodies might benefit from partitioning the range. 方法要求自定义分区程序以支持动态分区。The method expects custom partitioners to support dynamic partitioning. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [用于 PLINQ 和 TPL 的自定义分区程序](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl) 和 [如何：实现动态分区](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions)。For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl) and [How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions). `localInit`对于参与循环执行的每个任务，将调用该委托一次，并返回这些任务的初始本地状态。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 这些初始状态将传递给每个任务的第一次 `body` 调用。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然后，每个后续的主体调用都将返回一个可能修改的状态值，并将其传递给下一个主体调用。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最后，每个线程上的最后一个主体调用返回传递给委托的状态值 `localFinally` 。Finally, the last body invocation on each thread returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. 每 `localFinally` 个任务调用一次委托，以便对每个任务的本地状态执行最后一个操作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task's local state. 可对多个任务同时调用此委托;因此，必须同步对任何共享变量的访问。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 此 方法在其执行生存期内使用的任务比线程多，因为现有任务完成并被新任务取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 这使基础 对象有机会添加、更改或删除为循环提供服务的线程。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`为可枚举中的每个元素调用一次委托 `source` 。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each element in the `source` enumerable. 提供了以下参数：当前元素、 可能用于提前跳出循环的实例、当前元素的索引 () ，以及可能在同一线程上执行的迭代之间共享的某些本地状态。It is provided with the following parameters: the current element, a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, the current element's index (), and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`对于参与循环执行的每个任务，将调用该委托一次，并返回这些任务的初始本地状态。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 这些初始状态将传递给每个任务的第一次 `body` 调用。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然后，每个后续的主体调用都将返回一个可能修改的状态值，并将其传递给下一个主体调用。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最后，每个任务的最后一个主体调用返回传递给委托的状态值 `localFinally` 。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`每个线程调用一次委托，以便对每个任务的本地状态执行最后一个操作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per thread to perform a final action on each task's local state. 可对多个任务同时调用此委托;因此，必须同步对任何共享变量的访问。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 此 方法在其执行生存期内使用的任务比线程多，因为现有任务完成并被新任务取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 这使基础 对象有机会添加、更改或删除为循环提供服务的线程。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可用于执行可能并行执行的一组操作。This method can be used to execute a set of operations, potentially in parallel. 不保证执行操作的顺序，或是否并行执行操作。No guarantees are made about the order in which the operations execute or whether they execute in parallel. 此方法在每个提供的操作都已完成后才会返回，无论是由于正常终止还是异常终止而发生。This method does not return until each of the provided operations has completed, regardless of whether completion occurs due to normal or exceptional termination. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：使用 Parallel.Invoke 来执行并行操作](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations)。For more information, see [How to: Use Parallel.Invoke to Execute Parallel Operations](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations). ## Examples 此示例演示如何将 方法与其他方法、匿名委托和 lambda 表达式一起使用。This example demonstrates how to use the method with other methods, anonymous delegates, and lambda expressions. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可用于执行可能并行执行的一组操作。This method can be used to execute a set of operations, potentially in parallel. 与结构一起传入的取消标记 允许调用方取消整个操作。The cancellation token passed in with the structure enables the caller to cancel the entire operation. 有关详细信息，请参阅[托管线程中的取消](/dotnet/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads)。For more information, see [Cancellation in Managed Threads](/dotnet/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads). 不保证执行操作的顺序，或是否并行执行操作。No guarantees are made about the order in which the operations execute or whether they execute in parallel. 此方法在每个提供的操作都已完成后才会返回，无论是由于正常终止还是异常终止而发生。This method does not return until each of the provided operations has completed, regardless of whether completion occurs due to normal or exceptional termination. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：使用 Parallel.Invoke 来执行并行操作](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations)。For more information, see [How to: Use Parallel.Invoke to Execute Parallel Operations](/dotnet/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations).
